comments:
Run a Bottom up scenario and select Test on the first page.  Run thru service 
creation and click "Launch" on the Test page.

The command which launches the WSE doesn't expect a module qualified service 
project name.

In WSEGenerateCommand.java.. line 37:
   IProject project = (IProject) ProjectUtilities.getProject
(testInfo.getServiceProject());

 testInfo.getServiceProject() return "/Project/moduleName" where it used to 
just return the project name.

Here's the stack trace:

Hi Kathy, 
I have attached the patches, could you please commit them?

These patches include the obvious change to handle "/project/moduleName", and I 
also had to fix a bug in the SimpleCommandFactory and the WSDLTestLaunchCommand 
wasn't getting the next command correctly.

The WS Explorer comes up now with any errors.

Created an attachment (id=20464)
WSDLTestLaunchCommand patch2

The command now does the checking if hasNext().  So, the command.env.core patch
is no longer required.

Created an attachment (id=20467)
ServerWidgetBinding patch

Adds a mapping for server instance id.

Patch slightly modified to fix commandFactoryExecution() and handleLaunchButton
().

Changes committed and released as v20050428_1716.
